title: GRADE guidelines repository in a bookdown
text:
This is the website for the work-in-progress “GRADE Guidelines Repository in a bookdown”. This book brings together the GRADE (Grading of Recommendations, Assessment, Development, and Evaluations) guidelines articles, available in the journals in which they have been published over time. In addition, you will find links to available resources on the GRADE methodology in english and spanish.
According to the BMJ: “GRADE is a transparent framework for developing and presenting evidence summaries and provides a systematic approach to making clinical practice recommendations. It is the most widely adopted tool for grading the quality of evidence and for making recommendations, with more than 100 organizations worldwide officially endorsing GRADE.” 1
If you wish to contribute, you are welcome! Just send a pull request in the github repository .
This website is and will always be free, licensed under the CC BY-NC-ND 3.0 License.
Please note that “GRADE Guidelines Repository in a bookdown” uses a Contributor Code of Conduct. By contributing to this book, you agree to abide by its terms.

title: 1  GRADE guidelines
text:
In this section, you will find the complete and updated collection of the GRADE guidelines publications in BMJ and JCE since 2010 (including free and paid).











Important!



Since not all issues are free, we will only include the links to visit the web version of the publication from the magazine, sorry. The articles that are freely accessible are available in this repository, as well as their respective links.

title: 2  Summary
text:
In summary, this book has no content whatsoever.

1 + 1

title: GRADE guidelines repository in a bookdown
text:
Disclaimer
This publication has as its sole purpose, to gather and disseminate the information available on this Evidence Based Medicine methodology.

title: 2  GRADE Resources
text:
In this section, you will find a list of freely available resources to study and learn more about the GRADE methodology and its applications. This section will be constantly updated as we continue to find interesting resources to share.
Any suggestions are welcome :)
